oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Rev. John H. Hopkins to Bishop Leonidas Polk
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Rev. John H. Hopkins, Burlington, Vt. to Episcopal Bishop Polk discusses continuance of ecclesiastical relations during the Civil War, including lengthy details on political matters. "Wars must cease, governments must change." Other than a "few outrageous fanatics who desire the utter extinction of negro slavery" Hopkins had seen no evidence of a "desire to deprive the South of its Constitutional rights" though the South needed to remove the impression of aggression caused by the attack on Ft. Sumter.
